title: WhereIsMyName: Afghan women campaign for the right to reveal their name
description: Afghan women are often forced to keep their name secret, even from doctors. But some are fighting back.

title: From Yemen to Wales: 'I thought I would die under that lorry'
description: Forced to flee for his life, Mujahed Aqlan relives his perilous journey across Europe as a teenager.

title: 'Maskne' and bold makeup: How masks are changing how we look
description: Face masks are everywhere - and with them, the rise of "maskne" and new mask-friendly makeup trends.

title: PC Andrew Harper death: Innocent man's family 'torn apart' by murder charge
description: Jed Foster was charged with killing PC Andrew Harper before the case against him was dropped.

title: Week in pictures: 18 July-24 July 2020
description: A selection of powerful news photographs taken around the world this week.

title: Coronavirus: Obesity increases risks from Covid-19, experts say
description: Public Health England's conclusions come as ministers consider new measures to combat obesity.

title: Coronavirus: The vulnerable mum and daughter continuing to shield
description: A mother and daughter say they will continue to shield despite restrictions easing on 1 August.

title: Dog meat: Koreans are divided over the issue
description: Eating dog meat has become controversial within South Korea as growing numbers own dogs as pets.

title: WW2: The nun who saved my life
description: An extraordinary Catholic nun saved Hélène Ullrich and 82 other children during the Holocaust in France.

title: Coronavirus: The week when everything changed for Trump
description: The president underwent a series of U-turns in an effort to save his re-election chances.

title: Boohoo: Five things you may not know about the fashion firm
description: The Instagram-friendly fashion brand has seen a rapid rise, but could its success be under threat?

title: Almost 1,000 apply for receptionist job in Manchester
description: With the hospitality sector savaged by the pandemic, jobs are attracting many more applicants.

title: Liverpool staff broke touchline code - Lampard
description: Frank Lampard says his row with Liverpool's coaching staff on Wednesday was as a result of them breaking football's touchline code.

title: 'I deserve a UFC title shot' - Till ready for Whittaker challenge on Fight Island
description: Britain's Darren Till says he deserves a title shot as he prepares to face Robert Whittaker in the final event at the UFC's Fight Island.

title: Coronavirus prompts PM into obesity crackdown
description: Measures to cut obesity are yet to be finalised but could include a ban on junk food TV ads before 21:00.

title: Johnny Depp's lawyers say they have a video showing Amber Heard 'attacked' sister
description: The video was provided by an anonymous source on Thursday, the High Court hears.

title: Teenagers guilty of killing PC Andrew Harper
description: Three youths are convicted of manslaughter after the officer died as he was dragged behind their car.

title: Coronavirus: New face covering rules in force in England
description: Customers in shops, banks, post offices and takeaways are among those who must now wear masks.

title: England v West Indies: Joe Root run out by Roston Chase direct hit
description: A brilliant piece of fielding by Roston Chase runs out England captain Joe Root on day one of the third and final Test match of the series against West Indies.

title: Coronavirus: Portugal still on quarantine list for holidaymakers
description: Travellers from Portugal will have to self-isolate but restrictions are relaxed for other nations.

title: Coronavirus: 'Deadly masks' claims debunked
description: The BBC's anti-disinformation team has been investigating misleading health claims about wearing face coverings.

title: PC Andrew Harper: A death that sparked an outpouring of love
description: PC Andrew Harper's tragic killing led to tributes and support for the police being made from across the globe.

title: US lottery jackpot shared after 1992 handshake
description: Two friends agreed nearly 30 years ago that if one scooped the Powerball lottery they would split it.

title: US, Mexican & Brazilian Grands Prix cancelled, Imola set to return
description: Formula 1 abandons any hope of holding the US, Mexican and Brazilian Grands Prix this year as a result of the coronavirus situation in the Americas.

title: Most people in England to be offered flu vaccine
description: About 30 million people - including everyone over 50 - will be able to have a free flu vaccine.

title: Retail sales near pre-lockdown levels in June
description: Sales rose by 13.9%, official figures show, as the reopening of shops released pent-up demand.

title: Liverpool captain Henderson wins Football Writers' award
description: Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson is named the Football Writers' Association Men's Footballer of the Year.

title: Filey Bay stranded basking shark put down
description: The shark had attempted to beach itself and could not be persuaded to go back out to sea.

title: Coronavirus: 'We made a feature film in lockdown'
description: How some UK film makers have kept working during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Schmeichel says De Gea criticism is 'very harsh'
description: Leicester City goalkeeper Kasper Schmeichel condemns the "very harsh" criticism of Manchester United counterpart David de Gea since the Premier League's resumption.

title: Bob Willis Trophy: County fixtures - Essex start against Kent, Surrey meet Middlesex
description: The first fixtures for the truncated 2020 county cricket season, starting with the Bob Willis Trophy on 1 August, are released.

title: The Papers: 'Mask-up Friday' and 'flu jabs for 30 million'
description: Friday's papers include reaction to new rules on face coverings in England and flu vaccinations.

title: Taiwanese laundry-modelling grandparents are surprise Instagram hit
description: A man's wish to stop his grandparents being bored leads to unexpected fame and new happiness.

title: Harry and Meghan sue over 'drone photos' of son Archie
description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex claim pictures of Archie were taken at their US home during lockdown.
